HeroSection.description: Explore the fundamentals of data architecture through interactive modules, practical exercises, and self-assessments.
HeroSection.objective_1: Understand key concepts of data architecture.
HeroSection.objective_2: Identify different types of architectures and their use cases.
HeroSection.objective_3: Explore relevant tools and technologies in the field.
HeroSection.objective_4: Develop basic skills for designing simple data architectures.

ContentSection.title: Course Content
ContentSection.module_1_desc: Introduction to what data architecture is and why it's important.
ContentSection.module_2_pt2: Data Warehouse vs. Data Lake vs. Data Lakehouse.
ContentSection.module_3_desc: How data is stored and organized.

ExercisesSection.title: Interactive Exercises
ExercisesSection.drag_drop_desc: Organize the components of a simple data architecture by dragging them to their correct place.
ExercisesSection.order_steps_desc: Place the typical steps for implementing a Data Warehouse in order.
ExercisesSection.quiz_desc: Test your understanding of NoSQL database types with this multiple-choice quiz.
ExercisesSection.note: Note: Full interactive features will be implemented using pure JavaScript.

ContactSection.title: Help and Contact
ContactSection.card_desc_local: Do you have questions or suggestions? Leave us your message here.
ContactSection.placeholder_message: Write your query or comment here...
ContactSection.storage_note: Your message will be saved locally in your browser.
ContactSection.toast_internal_error_desc: Internal form error. Please refresh and try again.
ContactSection.toast_local_success_desc: Your message has been saved successfully.
ContactSection.toast_local_error_desc: There was a problem saving your message. Please try again.
ContactSection.local_storage_info_desc: This contact form saves messages directly in your browser's local storage. This is a temporary solution for demonstration purposes and does not involve a database or server-side processing.

Chatbot.faq_a1: Data architecture describes how data is collected, stored, transformed, distributed, and consumed within an organization. It is the master plan for data management.
Chatbot.faq_q2: What is the difference between Data Warehouse and Data Lake?
Chatbot.faq_a2: A Data Warehouse stores structured and processed data for specific analysis (BI). A Data Lake stores raw data in any format (structured, semi-structured, unstructured) for more flexible exploration and analysis.
Chatbot.faq_q3: Do I need to know programming for this course?
Chatbot.faq_a3: It is not strictly necessary to understand the fundamental concepts. However, basic knowledge of SQL or Python can be helpful for some practical examples.
Chatbot.faq_q4: How can I navigate the modules?
Chatbot.faq_a4: You can use the navigation bar at the top or click on the section titles on the main page to go directly to each module or section.
Chatbot.faq_a5: The interactive exercises and quick quizzes are mainly for self-assessment and practice. They are not part of a formal grade.
